data.title: Alabama Athletics
data.meta_description: Greg Farone (26) LHP - Career Accolades Selected in the seventh round of the 2024 MLB Draft (San Francisco Giants) 2024 Worked as a midweek starter and as a ...
data.text:
Career Accolades

Selected in the seventh round of the 2024 MLB Draft (San Francisco Giants)

2024

Worked as a midweek starter and as a reliever before earning a spot in the weekend rotation

Moved into the Friday night starter role by season's end

Appeared in 17 games (16 starts) and finished with a 4-3 record, including a complete game shutout in his start at Ole Miss

Owned a 5.02 ERA (40 ER/71.2 IP), the lowest mark among Alabama's starting staff

Struck out 68 compared to 24 walks while limiting opposing hitters to a .267 average

Tied for fifth in the SEC for starts with 16 overall, part of his 17 total appearances

Issued just 24 walks, the 13th-fewest among qualifying pitchers in the SEC

Allowed only 42 runs on the season to tie for the 14th-fewest in the conference

Logged a team-high 49.2 innings in SEC games, a total that finished 14th in the league

Earned the win at Ole Miss on April 25, throwing a complete game 7.0-inning shutout with six hits, no walks and six strikeouts across 91 total pitches

Picked up the first win of his Crimson Tide career on Feb. 25 against Valparaiso, tossing 3.0 innings and allowing one run on two hits with five strikeouts

Made his Alabama debut on Feb. 17 against Manhattan, working 1.0 scoreless, hitless inning with two strikeouts

2023 (Louisville)

Spent one season at the University of Louisville

Totaled 21 appearances with six starts for the Cardinals

Owned a 1-4 record with a 4.80 ERA across 50.2 innings of work

Ranked second on UL with 65 strikeouts while limiting opposing hitters to a .220 average

2021-2022 (Herkimer College)

Spent two seasons at Herkimer College in Herkimer, N.Y.

Selected as the 2022 NJCAA Division III Player of the Year

Also tabbed the NJCAA Division III Pitcher of the Year and a first team All-American

Led the Generals to the programâ€™s first NJCAA Division III national championship in program history

Earned World Series Most Valuable Player honors

Picked up NJCAA Division III Second Team All-America accolades in 2022

Set the program record for strikeouts in a season with 139 across 60.0 innings pitched as a freshman

Prep Highlights

Attended Schenectady High School in Schenectady, N.Y.

Personal Info

Greg Anthony Farone

Born on May 3, 2002

Son of Tony and Jess Farone

Has one brother, Scott

Majoring in criminology and criminal justice
